title: HIV Positive and proud: What’s with the stigma?
content: This video can not be playedHIV attitudes haven’t changed since the 1980s but Generation Z, people born in the mid 1990s to the early 2000s, is trying to change that.20-year-old HIV activist, Mercy Ngulube, debunks common misconceptions about HIV and tell us why she’s positive and proud.A BBC Stories and Orchard TV co-production.Produced by Ashni Lakhani and Adrian JonesExecutive Producer: Karlene Pinnock and Robert Light
